==Events==
* [[502]] &ndash; King [[Gundobad]] issues a new legal code (''[[Lex Burgundionum]]'') at [[Lyon]] that makes [[Gallo-Roman culture|Gallo-Romans]] and [[Burgundians]] subject to the same [[law]]s.
*[[1430]] &ndash; The [[Ottoman Empire]] under [[Murad II]] captures the [[Byzantine Empire|Byzantine]] city of [[Thessalonica]].
*[[1461]] &ndash; [[Wars of the Roses]]: [[Battle of Towton]] &ndash; Edward of York defeats [[Margaret of Anjou|Queen Margaret]] to become King [[Edward IV of England]].
*[[1500]] &ndash; [[Cesare Borgia]] is given the title of [[Captain General of the Church|Captain General]] and [[Gonfalonier of the Church|Gonfalonier]] by his father [[Rodrigo Borgia]] after returning from his conquests in the [[Romagna]].
*[[1549]] &ndash; The city of [[Salvador da Bahia]], the first capital of [[Brazil]], is founded.
*[[1632]] &ndash; [[Treaty of Saint-Germain-en-Laye (1632)|Treaty of Saint-Germain]] is signed returning [[Quebec]] to French control after the English had seized it in [[1629]].
*[[1638]] &ndash; Swedish colonists establish the first European settlement in [[Delaware]], naming it [[New Sweden]].
*[[1683]] &ndash; [[Yaoya Oshichi]], 15-year-old Japanese girl, burnt at the stake for an act of arson committed due to unrequited love.
*[[1792]] &ndash; King [[Gustav III of Sweden]] dies after being shot in the back at a midnight [[masquerade ball]] at [[Stockholm]]'s [[Royal Swedish Opera|Royal Opera]] 13 days earlier. He is succeeded by [[Gustav IV Adolf of Sweden|Gustav IV Adolf]].
*[[1806]] &ndash; Construction is authorized of the Great National Pike, better known as the [[Cumberland Road]], becoming the first United States federal [[Highway#United States|highway]].
*[[1809]] &ndash; King [[Gustav IV Adolf of Sweden]] [[abdication|abdicates]] after a ''[[coup d'état]]''. At the [[Diet of Porvoo]], Finland's [[Riksdag of the Estates|four Estates]] pledge allegiance to [[Alexander I of Russia]], commencing the secession of the [[Grand Duchy of Finland]] from [[Lands of Sweden|Sweden]].
*[[1831]] &ndash; [[Great Bosnian uprising]]: [[Bošnjani|Bosniaks]] rebel against [[Turkey]].
*[[1847]] &ndash; [[Mexican–American War]]: United States forces led by General [[Winfield Scott]] take [[Veracruz (city)|Veracruz]] after a [[Siege of Veracruz|siege]].
*[[1849]] &ndash; The United Kingdom annexes the [[Punjab region|Punjab]].
*[[1857]] &ndash; [[Sepoy]] [[Mangal Pandey]] of the 34th [[Regiment]], [[Bengal Native Infantry]] mutinies against the [[East India Company]]'s [[Company rule in India|rule in India]] and inspires the protracted [[Indian Rebellion of 1857]], also known as the Sepoy Mutiny.
*[[1865]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: Federal forces under Major General [[Philip Sheridan]] move to flank Confederate forces under Robert E. Lee as the [[Appomattox Campaign]] begins.
*[[1867]] &ndash; [[Victoria of the United Kingdom|Queen Victoria]] gives [[Royal Assent]] to the [[British North America Act]] which establishes the [[Dominion of Canada]] on [[July 1]].
*[[1871]] &ndash; The [[Royal Albert Hall]] is opened by Queen Victoria.
*[[1879]] &ndash; [[Anglo-Zulu War]]: [[Battle of Kambula]]: British forces defeat 20,000 [[Zulus]].
*[[1882]] &ndash; The [[Knights of Columbus]] are established.
*[[1886]] &ndash; Dr. [[John Pemberton]] brews the first batch of [[Coca-Cola]] in a backyard in [[Atlanta, Georgia]].
*[[1911]] &ndash; The [[M1911]] .45 ACP pistol becomes the official U.S. Army [[side arm]].
*[[1930]] &ndash; [[Heinrich Brüning]] is appointed German [[Chancellor of Germany (German Reich)|Reichskanzler]].
*[[1936]] &ndash; In Germany, [[Adolf Hitler]] receives 99% of the votes in a [[referendum]] to ratify Germany's illegal [[remilitarization of the Rhineland|reoccupation]] of the [[Rhineland]], receiving 44.5&nbsp;million votes out of 45.5&nbsp;million registered voters.
*[[1941]] &ndash; The [[North American Radio Broadcasting Agreement]] goes into effect at 03:00 local time.
*  1941   &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Armed Forces of the United Kingdom|British]] [[Royal Navy]] and [[Royal Australian Navy]] forces defeat those of the Italian ''[[Regia Marina]]'' off the [[Peloponnesus|Peloponnesian]] coast of Greece in the [[Battle of Cape Matapan]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; The [[Bombing of Lübeck in World War II]] is the first major success for the [[RAF Bomber Command]] against Germany and a German city.
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: Last day of [[V-1 flying bomb]] attacks on England.
*  1945   &ndash; World War II: The German [[4th Army (Wehrmacht)|4th Army]] is [[Heiligenbeil Pocket|almost destroyed]] by the Soviet [[Red Army]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; [[Instituto Tecnológico Autónomo de México]], one of Mexico's leading universities, is founded.
*[[1947]] &ndash; [[Malagasy Uprising]] against French colonial rule in Madagascar.
*[[1951]] &ndash; [[Ethel and Julius Rosenberg]] are convicted of conspiracy to commit [[espionage]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; The [[New York, Ontario and Western Railway]] makes its final run, the first major U.S. railroad to be abandoned in its entirety.
*[[1961]] &ndash; The [[Twenty-third Amendment to the United States Constitution]] is ratified, allowing residents of [[Washington, D.C.]], to vote in presidential elections.
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[Arturo Frondizi]], the president of Argentina, is overthrown in a military coup by Argentina's armed forces, ending an 11½ day constitutional crisis.
*[[1971]] &ndash; [[My Lai massacre]]: [[Lieutenant]] [[William Calley]] is convicted of premeditated murder and sentenced to life in prison.
*  1971   &ndash; A [[Los Angeles, California]] jury recommends the [[Capital punishment|death penalty]] for [[Charles Manson]] and three female followers.
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: The last United States combat soldiers leave [[South Vietnam]].
*  1973   &ndash; [[Operation Barrel Roll]], a covert US bombing campaign in [[Laos]] to stop [[PAVN|communist infiltration]] of [[South Vietnam]], ends.
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[NASA]]'s [[Mariner 10]] becomes the first [[spaceprobe]] to fly by [[Mercury (planet)|Mercury]].
*  1974   &ndash; Local farmers in [[Lintong District]], [[Xi'an]], [[Shaanxi]] province, China, discover the [[Terracotta Army]] that was buried with [[Qin Shi Huang]], the first [[Emperor of China]], in the third century BCE.
*[[1982]] &ndash; The [[Canada Act 1982 (U.K.)]] receives the [[Royal Assent]] from [[Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom|Queen Elizabeth II]], setting the stage for the [[Monarchy of Canada|Queen of Canada]] to proclaim the [[Constitution Act, 1982]].
*[[1984]] &ndash; The [[Indianapolis Colts|Baltimore Colts]] load its possessions onto fifteen [[Mayflower Transit|Mayflower]] moving trucks in the early morning hours and transfer its operations to [[Indianapolis]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; The [[Czechoslovakia|Czechoslovak]] parliament is unable to reach an agreement on what to call the country after the fall of [[Communism]], sparking the so-called [[Hyphen War]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Catherine Callbeck]] becomes [[premier]] of [[Prince Edward Island]] and the first woman to be elected in a general election as premier of a Canadian province.
*[[1999]] &ndash; The [[Dow Jones Industrial Average]] closes above the 10,000 mark (10,006.78) for the first time, during the height of the [[internet boom]].
*  1999   &ndash; A [[1999 Chamoli earthquake|magnitude 6.8 earthquake]] strikes the [[Chamoli district]] in the Indian state of [[Uttar Pradesh]], killing 103.
*[[2002]] &ndash; In reaction to the [[Passover massacre]] two days prior, [[Israel]] launches [[Operation Defensive Shield]] against [[Palestinian political violence|Palestinian militants]], its largest military operation in the [[West Bank]] since the 1967 [[Six-Day War]].
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[Bulgaria]], [[Estonia]], [[Latvia]], [[Lithuania]], [[Romania]], [[Slovakia]] and [[Slovenia]] join [[NATO]] as full members.
*  2004   &ndash; The [[Republic of Ireland]] becomes the first country in the world to [[smoking ban|ban smoking]] in all work places, including bars and restaurants.
*[[2010]] &ndash; Two female suicide bombers [[2010 Moscow Metro terrorist bombings|hit the Moscow Metro system]] at the peak of the morning rush hour, killing 40.
*[[2013]] &ndash; At least 36 people are killed when a 16-floor [[2013 Dar es Salaam building collapse|building collapses]] in the commercial capital [[Dar es Salaam]], [[Tanzania]].
*  2013   &ndash; A [[2013 Gyama Mine landslide|landslide]] kills 66 people in [[China]]'s [[Tibet Autonomous Region|Tibetan Autonomous Region]] near [[Lhasa]].
*[[2014]] &ndash; The first [[Same-sex marriage in the United Kingdom|same-sex marriages]] in England and Wales are performed.
